meanings.definition: Too long, slow, or dull; tiresome or monotonous.
meanings.sent1: The tedious task of counting all the grains of sand on the beach made me sleepy.
meanings.sent2: The lecture was so tedious that many students struggled to stay awake.
meanings.sent3: Watching paint dry is less tedious than listening to that boring speech.
meanings.sent4: The never-ending meeting felt like a tedious journey through a desert of boredom.
meanings.sent5: The repetitive nature of the task made it feel more tedious than watching grass grow.

meanings.sent1: The tedious movie made me yawn multiple times.
meanings.sent2: The tedious chore of washing dishes seemed never-ending.
meanings.sent3: The tedious wait for the bus felt like an eternity.
meanings.sent4: The tedious music in the elevator grated on my nerves.
meanings.sent5: The tedious book was a struggle to finish due to its lack of excitement.
